放.definition: to put; to place; to release; to free; to let go; to let out; to set off (fireworks)

放一馬.definition: to let (sb) off; to let (sb) get away with sth

放下.definition: to lay down; to put down; to let go of; to relinquish; to set aside; to lower (the blinds etc)

放下包袱.definition: to lay down a heavy burden

放下屠刀，立地成佛.pinyin: fang4 xia4 tu2 dao1 , li4 di4 cheng2 fo2
放下屠刀，立地成佛.definition: lay down butcher's knife, become a Buddha on the spot (idiom); instant rehabilitation; to repent and be absolved of one's crimes

放下身段.definition: (idiom) to get off one's high horse; to dispense with posturing (and adopt a more humble or empathetic attitude)

放不下.definition: to have no room to put sth; to be unable to let go

放之四海而皆準.pinyin: fang4 zhi1 si4 hai3 er2 jie1 zhun3

放任.definition: to ignore; to let alone; to indulge

放任自流.definition: to let sb do whatever they want; to indulge; to give free reins to; to let things slide; to drift aimlessly; laissez-faire

放倒.definition: to knock over; to knock down; to lay flat; to fell; to bring down

放假.definition: to have a holiday or vacation

放債.definition: to lend money (for interest); to give credit

放出.definition: to let off; to give out

放刁.definition: to act wickedly; to bully; to make life difficult for sb by unreasonable actions

放哨.definition: to keep watch; to do sentry duty; to be on patrol

放在心上.definition: to care about; to take seriously; to take to heart

放在眼裡.definition: to pay attention to; to care about; to attach importance to

放大炮.definition: to talk big; to shoot one's mouth off

放大片.definition: (Tw) cosmetic contact lens; big eye contact lens; circle contact lens

放學.definition: to dismiss students at the end of the school day

放寬.definition: to relax (a rule); to ease (restrictions); to extend (a time limit); to let out (a garment); to expand; to broaden

放射免疫測定.pinyin: fang4 she4 mian3 yi4 ce4 ding4

放射性同位素.pinyin: fang4 she4 xing4 tong2 wei4 su4

放射性沾染物.pinyin: fang4 she4 xing4 zhan1 ran3 wu4

放射性落下灰.pinyin: fang4 she4 xing4 luo4 xia4 hui1

放屁.definition: to fart; to break wind; to talk nonsense; Utter rubbish!

放工.definition: to knock off work for the day

放平.definition: to set level; to lay flat

放得下.definition: to be able to put (sth) down; to have room for; to be able to accommodate

放心.definition: to feel relieved; to feel reassured; to be at ease

放情.definition: to do sth to one's heart's content

放情丘壑.definition: to enjoy oneself in nature's embrace (idiom)

放慢.definition: to reduce the pace (of movements, steps etc)

放慢腳步.definition: to ease up the pace; to slow things down

放慢速度.definition: to ease up the pace; to slow things down

放手.definition: to let go one's hold; to give up; to have a free hand

放手一搏.definition: to put one's all into the fight

放棄.definition: to renounce; to abandon; to give up

放槍.definition: to open fire; to shoot a gun

放權.definition: to devolve authority to lower levels

放款.definition: to lend money (as a commercial loan)

放毒.definition: to poison; (fig.) to spread vicious rumors

放氣.definition: to release breath; to deflate; to fart

放水.definition: to turn on the water; to let water out; (sports) to throw a game

放浪.definition: unrestrained; dissolute; dissipated; unconventional; immoral; to debauch; to dissipate

放火.definition: to set on fire; to commit arson; to create a disturbance

放焰口.definition: to feed the starving ghosts (i.e. offer sacrifice to protect the departed spirit)

放生.definition: to set free a captive animal (in some cases, as an act of Buddhist mercy)

放療.definition: radiotherapy (abbr. for 放射療法|放射疗法[fang4she4 liao2fa3]); to treat by radiotherapy

放眼望去.definition: as far as the eye can see

放空.definition: to relax completely; to empty one's mind; (finance) to sell short; (of a commercial vehicle) to travel empty (no cargo or passengers); to deadhead

放空擋.definition: to coast along in neutral gear (in a car); (coll.) to go commando

放空炮.definition: (lit.) to fire blank shots; (fig.) to be all talk and no action; to shoot one's mouth off; to make empty promises

放線.definition: (angling) to play a fish; (kite-flying) to let the string out; (dating) to play the field

放緩.definition: to slow; to slow down (the pace of)

放縱.definition: to indulge; to pamper; to connive at; permissive; indulgent; self-indulgent; unrestrained; undisciplined; uncultured; boorish

放羊.definition: to tend a flock of sheep; to let sheep out to pasture; fig. to throw off the reins; to leave sb alone; acting freely and irresponsibly

放聲.definition: very loudly; at the top of one's voice

放著明白裝糊塗.pinyin: fang4 zhe5 ming2 bai5 zhuang1 hu2 tu5

放血.definition: (TCM) to practice bloodletting; (medicine) to perform phlebotomy; (coll.) to make sb bleed; to inflict grievous wounds; (fig.) to cough up a large amount of money; (fig.) to reduce prices drastically

放衛星.definition: to launch a satellite; (fig.) (neologism during the Great Leap Forward, c. 1958) to achieve prominent success; (later used sarcastically) to make exaggerated claims; to talk big

放話.definition: to give orders; to spread news or rumors; to leak certain information intentionally

放走.definition: to release; to set free; to allow (a person or an animal) to go; to liberate

放送.definition: to broadcast; to announce over loudspeakers

放逐.definition: to banish; to deport; to send into exile; to be marooned

放過.definition: to let off; to let slip by; to let sb get away with sth

放還.definition: to release (a hostage); to put back in place

放長線釣大魚.pinyin: fang4 chang2 xian4 diao4 da4 yu2
放長線釣大魚.definition: use a long line to catch a big fish (idiom); a long-term plan for major returns

放閃.definition: (coll.) (of a couple) to display affection in public or by posting photos on social media

放電.definition: electrical discharge; (coll.) to lure; to entice

放風.definition: to allow in fresh air; to allow a prisoner out for exercise; to give out information

放飛機.definition: (coll.) to stand sb up; to fail to honor an agreement

放養.definition: to raise (livestock or poultry) in an open environment; to breed (fish, bees, silkworms etc) in a suitable environment; to culture (kelp etc); to release (a captive animal) into the wild

放馬後炮.definition: to fire after the horse has bolted (idiom); to act too late to be effective

放馬過來.definition: bring it on!; give me all you got!

放鬆.definition: to relax; to slacken; to loosen

放鴿子.definition: to stand sb up; to bail on sb
